entries.title: What is Elide?
entries.content: Elide is a polyglot runtime built on GraalVM and the Truffle framework. It enables running JavaScript, TypeScript, Python 3.11, Java (JDK 24), and Kotlin (K2 v2.2.21) in a single unified runtime with zero-serialization cross-language calls.

entries.title: Supported Languages
entries.content: Elide supports: JavaScript (ES2020+), TypeScript (runs directly without build), Python 3.11 (via GraalPy), Java (JDK 24), Kotlin (K2 v2.2.21), and WebAssembly (experimental).

entries.title: GraalVM Foundation
entries.content: Elide is built on GraalVM and uses the Truffle language implementation framework. This enables zero-serialization polyglot interop through shared heap and unified garbage collection.

entries.title: Cold Start Performance
entries.content: Elide achieves approximately 10x faster cold starts than Node.js (~20ms vs ~200ms) due to eliminating V8 initialization overhead.

entries.title: HTTP Performance
entries.content: Elide achieves ~800K RPS on Linux with native transports (Netty). This is independently verified by TechEmpower benchmarks.

entries.title: Running Scripts
entries.content: Use 'elide run <file>' to execute scripts. Supports .ts, .js, .py extensions. Example: elide run server.ts

entries.title: Starting HTTP Server
entries.content: Use 'elide serve <file>' to start an HTTP server. Default port is 8080. Use --port flag for custom port. Example: elide serve server.ts --port 3000

entries.title: REPL Mode
entries.content: Use 'elide repl' to start an interactive REPL for testing code snippets.

entries.title: Project Initialization
entries.content: Use 'elide init' to create a new Elide project. This creates an elide.pkl configuration file interactively.

entries.title: Installing Dependencies
entries.content: Use 'elide install' to install project dependencies from elide.pkl and package.json. Use 'elide add <package>' to add new dependencies.

entries.title: Running Tests
entries.content: Use 'elide test' to run tests. Supports --coverage flag for coverage reports, --test-report=xml for XML reports, and --threaded for parallel execution (experimental).

entries.title: Debugging with Inspector
entries.content: Use 'elide run --inspect file.ts' to enable Chrome DevTools debugging. Use --inspect:wait to pause until debugger attaches. Use --inspect:port=9229 for custom port.

entries.title: Java/Kotlin Tools
entries.content: Elide embeds JDK tools: 'elide javac' (compile Java), 'elide kotlinc' (compile Kotlin), 'elide jar' (create JARs), 'elide javadoc' (generate docs). Use -- to pass flags to underlying tool.

entries.title: Native Image Building
entries.content: Use 'elide native-image -- <options> -o <output> <class>' to build native binaries. Supports PGO with --pgo-instrument and --pgo=<profile>.

entries.title: Container Building
entries.content: Use 'elide jib -- build -t <tag>' to build container images using Jib (no Docker daemon required).

entries.title: Fetch Handler Pattern
entries.content: The recommended HTTP pattern in beta11-rc1: 'export default async function fetch(req: Request): Promise<Response> { return new Response("OK"); }'. This is declarative and requires no imports.

entries.title: Deprecated Beta10 Shim
entries.content: DO NOT USE: 'import { serve } from "elide/http/server"'. This is the deprecated beta10 pattern. Migrate to fetch handler for beta11-rc1.

entries.title: Node.js HTTP Pattern
entries.content: Alternative pattern: 'import { createServer } from "node:http"; createServer((req,res)=>{ res.end("OK"); }).listen(8080);'. More imperative, gives more control over server lifecycle.

entries.title: Returning JSON
entries.content: Use Response.json(data) for JSON responses: 'return Response.json({ key: "value" });'. This automatically sets Content-Type header.

entries.title: Request Body Parsing
entries.content: Parse JSON body with: 'const body = await req.json();'. For form data: 'const form = await req.formData();'.

entries.title: CORS Headers
entries.content: Add CORS headers in response: '{ headers: { "Access-Control-Allow-Origin": "*", "Access-Control-Allow-Methods": "GET, POST, OPTIONS" } }'. Handle OPTIONS preflight requests.

entries.title: Streaming Responses
entries.content: Use ReadableStream for streaming: 'const stream = new ReadableStream({ start(c){ c.enqueue(data); c.close(); } }); return new Response(stream);'

entries.title: HTTP/2 Support
entries.content: Elide supports HTTP/2 via ALPN negotiation during TLS handshake. Configure TLS in elide.pkl server block.

entries.title: WebSocket Support
entries.content: WebSockets supported via Netty/Micronaut. Handle connection upgrades in fetch handler.

entries.title: WSGI Support
entries.content: Run Flask/Django apps with: 'elide run --wsgi app.py'. Enables Python web frameworks with zero-serialization TypeScript interop.

entries.title: elide.pkl File
entries.content: Project configuration file using Pkl language. First line must be: 'amends "elide:project.pkl"'. Define name, description, entrypoint, dependencies.

entries.title: Dependencies in elide.pkl
entries.content: Declare dependencies in elide.pkl. Supports npm, Maven, and PyPI packages. Elide also reads package.json, requirements.txt, and pyproject.toml.

entries.title: Server Configuration
entries.content: Configure server in elide.pkl: 'server { port = 8080; host = "0.0.0.0" }'. TLS config: 'server { tls { certFile = "cert.pem"; keyFile = "key.pem" } }'

entries.title: Kotlin Features
entries.content: Enable KotlinX libraries: 'kotlin { features { kotlinx = true } }'. Includes coroutines, datetime, serialization, and HTML libraries.

entries.title: Zero-Serialization Interop
entries.content: Elide enables cross-language calls with <1ms overhead through Truffle's shared heap. No JSON serialization needed between TypeScript, Python, Java, Kotlin.

entries.title: Importing Python
entries.content: Import Python modules directly: 'import calculator from "./calculator.py"; const result = calculator.add(5, 3);'

entries.title: Flask + TypeScript
entries.content: Combine Flask backend with TypeScript orchestration using --wsgi flag. Flask routes handle Python logic, TypeScript handles API composition.

entries.title: Importing Java
entries.content: Use Java classes: 'const HashMap = Java.type("java.util.HashMap"); const map = new HashMap();'

entries.title: Node.js Module Imports
entries.content: Use node: prefix for Node.js built-ins: 'import { readFileSync } from "node:fs"; import { join } from "node:path";'

entries.title: Beta10 Shim Migration
entries.content: If using 'import { serve } from "elide/http/server"', migrate to fetch handler pattern. Remove shim import, export default async function fetch.

entries.title: Console.log at Top Level
entries.content: Avoid console.log at module top level in fetch handlers. Move inside the fetch function to prevent module evaluation issues.

entries.title: Missing node: Prefix
entries.content: If imports fail for Node.js modules, add 'node:' prefix. Example: 'import { readFileSync } from "node:fs"' instead of 'import fs from "fs"'

entries.title: React Version
entries.content: Use React 18, not React 19. Install with: 'elide add react@18 react-dom@18'

entries.title: WSGI Not Working
entries.content: For Flask/Django, ensure using --wsgi flag: 'elide run --wsgi app.py'. Verify Flask app is defined correctly with 'app = Flask(__name__)'.

entries.title: Port Already in Use
entries.content: If default port 8080 is busy, use --port flag: 'elide serve server.ts --port 3000'. Or change in elide.pkl server configuration.

entries.title: Missing elide.pkl
entries.content: Create elide.pkl with: 'amends "elide:project.pkl"' as first line. Add name, description, and entrypoint.

entries.title: process.argv Quirk
entries.content: process.argv may return Java array representation. For CLI detection, use: 'if (import.meta.url.includes("script-name.ts"))' instead.

entries.title: Performance Characteristics
entries.content: Cold start: ~20ms (10x faster than Node). RPS: ~800K on Linux. Memory: No V8 init overhead. Cross-language: <1ms overhead.

entries.title: Native Image Benefits
entries.content: Native image compilation provides faster cold starts and smaller binaries. Use PGO for additional 20-30% performance improvement.

entries.title: Test Commands
entries.content: Basic: 'elide test'. With coverage: 'elide test --coverage --coverage-format=json'. With report: 'elide test --test-report=xml'. Parallel: 'elide test --threaded --threads=4'

entries.title: Test Filtering
entries.content: Filter tests by pattern: 'elide test --filter="pattern"'. Set timeout: 'elide test --timeout=5000'

entries.title: Native Image Build
entries.content: Build optimized native: 'elide native-image -- -O3 --no-fallback -o myapp MyClass'. For PGO: first build with --pgo-instrument, run to generate profile, rebuild with --pgo=default.iprof

entries.title: Container Build
entries.content: Build with Jib: 'elide jib -- build -t myapp:latest'. Custom base: 'elide jib -- build --from=gcr.io/distroless/base -t myapp'

entries.title: Chrome DevTools
entries.content: Enable inspector: 'elide run --inspect file.ts'. Wait for attach: '--inspect:wait'. Custom port: '--inspect:port=9229'. Open chrome://inspect in Chrome.

entries.title: I/O Permissions
entries.content: Grant file I/O: '--host:allow-io'. Read-only: '--host:allow-io=/path:ro'. Write-only: '--host:allow-io=/path:wo'. Multiple paths: use flag multiple times.

entries.title: Secrets Management
entries.content: Set secrets: 'elide secrets set API_KEY value'. Access in code via environment variables or Elide secrets API.

entries.title: LLM Inference Server
entries.content: Production-ready OpenAI-compatible API with streaming, batch processing, rate limiting, and billing. Uses fetch handler pattern.

entries.title: Flask-TypeScript Polyglot
entries.content: Demonstrates combining Flask (Python) with TypeScript orchestration. Shows zero-serialization interop between languages.

entries.title: Service Mesh
entries.content: Microservices architecture with load balancing, circuit breakers, and distributed tracing. Uses Elide's native HTTP server.
